answerText: Ethiopia[10] Many of Gabre-Medhin's plays, as well as much Ethiopian poetry, is written in this language.  A Semitic language, in its written form each character represents a consonant-vowel pair.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 5 | 21 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One author from this nation wrote the plays Oda Oak Oracle and Petros at the Hour, which tells of the bishop Abuna Petros, who resisted a fascist takeover of this nation.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this country, home to Tsegaye Gabre-Medhin.  It is the setting of Samuel Johnson's Rasselas, though in that work it is known by the name Abyssinia.
